Authors: Indrianti Y., Sasmoko, Mohd Amin N.F., Rabiha S.G., Setiadi N.J., Handrimurtjahjo A.D., Waspodo M.
Title: Entrepreneurial Mindfulness Based on Artificial Intelligence
Affiliations: Entrepreneurship Department, Podomoro University, Center for Research on Education and Culture Policy, Ministry of Education and Culture of the Republic of Indonesia, Jakarta, 11470, Indonesia; Primary Teacher Education Department, Faculty of Humanities, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Department of Technical and Engineering Education, School of Education, Faculty of Social Sciences and Humanities, Universiti Teknologi Malaysia, Malaysia
Authors with affiliations: Indrianti, Y., Entrepreneurship Department, Podomoro University, Center for Research on Education and Culture Policy, Ministry of Education and Culture of the Republic of Indonesia, Jakarta, 11470, Indonesia; Sasmoko, Primary Teacher Education Department, Faculty of Humanities, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Mohd Amin, N.F., Department of Technical and Engineering Education, School of Education, Faculty of Social Sciences and Humanities, Universiti Teknologi Malaysia, Malaysia; Rabiha, S.G., Entrepreneurship Department, Podomoro University, Center for Research on Education and Culture Policy, Ministry of Education and Culture of the Republic of Indonesia, Jakarta, 11470, Indonesia; Setiadi, N.J., Entrepreneurship Department, Podomoro University, Center for Research on Education and Culture Policy, Ministry of Education and Culture of the Republic of Indonesia, Jakarta, 11470, Indonesia; Handrimurtjahjo, A.D., Entrepreneurship Department, Podomoro University, Center for Research on Education and Culture Policy, Ministry of Education and Culture of the Republic of Indonesia, Jakarta, 11470, Indonesia; Waspodo, M., Entrepreneurship Department, Podomoro University, Center for Research on Education and Culture Policy, Ministry of Education and Culture of the Republic of Indonesia, Jakarta, 11470, Indonesia
Abstract: The ability to self-diagnose to build capacity as an entrepreneur is something that is important in order to bridge the development of self-competence needed in the industrial era 4.0. This ability is expected to bring up a condition in which a person has full active awareness of the awakening of the entrepreneurial spirit within himself to then produce a productive person called Entrepreneurial Mindfulness. This study aims to develop self-detection tools about Entrepreneurial Mindfulness through an artificial intelligence-based website for students and alumni who are entrepreneurs.The research method used is the Neuroresearch method for developing Entrepreneurial Mindfulness measurement tools and the waterfall method for developing Artificial Intelligence-based websites. The results of research in the form of an Artificial Intelligence-based website about Entrepreneurial Mindfulness where the website will be able to provide profiling based on diagnoses made related to the level of Entrepreneurial Mindfulness owned by students and alumni in implementing entrepreneurial practices. © 2020 Published under licence by IOP Publishing Ltd.
Index Keywords: Websites; Measurement tools; research methods; Self detection; Self-diagnose; Waterfall methods; Artificial intelligence

Authors: Rosyidi U., Sasmoko, Indrianti Y., Manalu S.R., Lubis R., Moniaga J., Abu Bakar A.Y.B.
Title: Designing Face Recognition Teacher Wellbeing Application that Optimizes Teacher's Quality Work Life
Affiliations: Education Management Department, Faculty of Education, Universitas Negeri Jakarta, Jakarta, 13220, Indonesia; Primary Teacher Education Department, Faculty of Humanities, Bina Nusantara University, Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Entrepreneurship Department, Podomoro University, Jakarta, 11470, Indonesia; Faculty of Education, Universiti Kebangsaan Malaysia, Malaysia
Authors with affiliations: Rosyidi, U., Education Management Department, Faculty of Education, Universitas Negeri Jakarta, Jakarta, 13220, Indonesia; Sasmoko, Primary Teacher Education Department, Faculty of Humanities, Bina Nusantara University, Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Indrianti, Y., Entrepreneurship Department, Podomoro University, Jakarta, 11470, Indonesia; Manalu, S.R., Faculty of Education, Universiti Kebangsaan Malaysia, Malaysia; Lubis, R., Faculty of Education, Universiti Kebangsaan Malaysia, Malaysia; Moniaga, J., Faculty of Education, Universiti Kebangsaan Malaysia, Malaysia; Abu Bakar, A.Y.B., Faculty of Education, Universiti Kebangsaan Malaysia, Malaysia
Abstract: Meeting the demands of industry 4.0, teachers are required to improve the quality of their profession. Quality professions will not be achieved if the teacher does not have a quality person andat the same time prosperous. By utilizing technological developments, the teacher can monitor and diagnose the condition of the self wellbeing on an ongoing basis, so as to optimize the quality of work life. Teacher's Quality Work Life is very important for teachers themselves as educators, institutions and the nation and state. Quality work life can be a measure of teacher growth vertically and horizontally along with the growth of the institution. The encounter of Education, psychologicaltrait with Artificial Intelligence is called Positive Education is the main objective of this research. One form is a self diagnostic that is able to diagnose psychological conditions to produce optimal quality. This research aims to create an application face recognition design through Neuroresearch and Waterfall research methods. The results of the study were designed to build the Face Recognition Teacher Wellbeing application. © 2020 Published under licence by IOP Publishing Ltd.
Index Keywords: Artificial intelligence; Job satisfaction; Quality of work life; Quality profession; Self-diagnostics; Technological development; Wellbeing; Work life; Face recognition

Authors: Sasmoko, Indrianti Y., Purnomo F., Khairuddin Bin Ramly M.
Title: Instrument Calibration on the ASEAN Entrepreneurship Profiling Website
Source title: 2020 8th International Conference on Cyber and IT Service Management, CITSM 2020
Affiliations: Bina Nusantara University, Primary Teacher Education Department, Jakarta, Indonesia; Podomoro University, Entrepreneurship Department, Jakarta, Indonesia; Bina Nusantara University, Computer Science Department, Jakarta, Indonesia; Universiti Teknologi Malaysia, Business Administration Department, Johor Bahru, Malaysia
Authors with affiliations: Sasmoko, Bina Nusantara University, Primary Teacher Education Department, Jakarta, Indonesia; Indrianti, Y., Podomoro University, Entrepreneurship Department, Jakarta, Indonesia; Purnomo, F., Bina Nusantara University, Computer Science Department, Jakarta, Indonesia; Khairuddin Bin Ramly, M., Universiti Teknologi Malaysia, Business Administration Department, Johor Bahru, Malaysia
Abstract: Entrepreneurship as a major contributor to the economic development of a country needs to be studied specifically. The ASEAN Entrepreneurship Profiling website was developed to become a digital tool for entrepreneurs to carry out self-assessments and self-diagnostics related to their entrepreneurial profile. Before going to the further development stage, the instruments that will be the main pillars of website development need to be calibrated to produce valid and reliable instruments and coded on the website. The research used the survey method as part of the overall research method concept, namely the Neuroresearch method. This study uses the Neuroresearch method because this method has comprehensive stages in accordance with the research objectives. The calibration result is an indicator that crystallizes from six indicators into three indicators with instrument items from 17 to 16. © 2020 IEEE.
Author Keywords: ASEAN entrepreneurship profiling; instrument calibration; neuroresearch; website
Index Keywords: Calibration; Digital devices; Development needs; Development stages; Instrument calibrations; research methods; Research objectives; Self assessment; Self-diagnostics; Survey methods; Websites
